alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:00PM EST until December 19 at 10:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey...New York... Ramapo River near Mahwah affecting Bergen, Passaic, Rockland and Orange Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Mahwah...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River near Mahwah. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, State Route 202 floods downstream. Moderate flooding along Route 202 and Route 17. Water into backyards. Minor flooding along Brakeshoe Place, Brook Street and Catherine Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM EST Tuesday was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.7 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 03/25/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Ramapo River Mahwah 8.0 9.0 Tue 1 pm EST 7.0 6.2 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EST.
